name: rankval3
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0
body: |- wceq(cfv(crnk, c0), cint(crab(s0, con0, wral(s1, c0, wcel(cfv(crnk, cv(s1)), cv(s0))))))

stmt.origin: ax-mp(wceq(cfv(crnk, c0), cint(crab(s0, con0, wral(s1, c0, wcel(cfv(crnk, cv(s1)), cv(s0)))))), wcel(c0, cuni(cima(cr1, con0))))
stmt.pretty: ax-mp((rank ` c0)= ⋂ { s0 ∈ On | ∀(s1 ∈ c0,(rank ` s1)∈ s0)}, c0 ∈ ⋃(R1 " On))

|- wceq(cfv(crnk, c0), cint(crab(s0, con0, wral(s1, c0, wcel(cfv(crnk, cv(s1)), cv(s0))))))

comment: The value of the rank function expressed recursively: the rank of a set is the smallest ordinal number containing the ranks of all members of the set. Proposition 9.17 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 79. (Contributed by NM, 11-Oct-2003.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 17-Nov-2014.)
